alert.note: Alert for Clinton (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued May 15 at 5:15PM CDT until May 15 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR CENTRAL CLINTON COUNTY... At 515 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated that between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is expected. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Breese, Carlyle, Germantown, Beckemeyer, Bartelso and Stolletown. This includes the following highways... Interstate 64 in Illinois near exit 34. Thunderstorms have ended, however runoff from heavy rainfall is still occurring. Remain alert for flash flooding through the remainder of the afternoon into the evening. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
